document_data.name: Karlmuth Hauntokh
document_data.mainbody: '''Karlmuth Hauntokh''' was a prospector of the [[Western Heartlands]] in the mid-3{{rd}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: He was fatter and hairier than Surgath Ilder, and dressed in tattered clothes.
document_data.Personality: He was more arrogant than [[Surgath Ilder]].
document_data.Possessions: As of {{yearlink|240}}, he had a stout, worn sword, a smattering of utilitarian devices, and had looted a golden sphere set in with gems from an [[elven]] tomb which he claimed to be from [[Elanvae]]. He also wore a ring with a scratched device of a serpent ready to strike, which was shared by some bandits of the [[Skuldaskar]], including [[Drace (bandit)|Drace]] and [[Algan]].
document_data.History: In {{yearlink|240}}, he was present at the [[Herald's Horn]] tavern the night that [[Elminster Aumar]] purchased a ''[[wyrmtongue scepter]]'' from [[Surgath Ilder]]. Karlmuth Hauntokh showed some of his own loot, and later inspected one of the [[ruby|rubies]] which Elminster had paid Surgath with. The prince noticed that Karlmuth wore a ring with the same motif as some bandits that had attacked him earlier.
